title: Craftsmen young and old
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, production company
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Indians of North America - Canada
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Indians of North America - Canada - Social life and customs
description: A screen magazine containing three items: "Man who makes monsters" Dinosaurs, towering reptiles and other prehistoric creatures, all made of concrete by John Kanerva, turn Calgary Park into a primeval zoo; "All the family carves" Visit to the home workshop of Andre Bourgault, famous French-Canadian sculptor, whose children are learning his craft; "Last of the totem makers" Chief Mango Martin and his son preserve in their carving of totem poles, a unique art of Canada's Pacific coast Indians.
